full_text: Page 2851 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET L-TIER DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 8:00-8:30 AM 808 810 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 4:00-4:30 PM 914 911 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 12:30- 1:00 AM 8:30- 9:00 AM 833 836 4:30-5:00 PM 955 959 1:00-1:30 AM 9:00-9:30 AM 912 914 5:00 -5:30 PM 502 507 1:30-2:00 AM 9:30-10:00 AM 946 950 5:30-6:00 PM 533 533 2:00-2:30 AM 10:00-10:30 AM 1016 1019 6:00-6:30 PM 608 608 2:30-3:00 AM 10:30-11:00 AM 1057 1058 6:30-7:00 PM 640 640 3:00-3:30 AM 11:00-11:30 AM 1126 1127 7:00-7:30 PM 713 713 3:30-4:00 AM 11:30-12:00 AM 1134 1135 7:30-8:00 PM 735 735 4:00-4:30 AM 12:00-12:30 PM 1222 1213 8:00-8:30 PM 803 803 4:30-5:00 AM 12:30- 1:00 PM 1247 1249 8:30- 9:00 PM 838 838 5:00 -5:30 AM 1:00-1:30 PM 106 108 9:00-9:30 PM 804 804 5:30-6:00 AM 1:30-2:00 PM 143 144 9:30-10:00 PM 934 934 6:00-6:30 AM 2:00-2:30 PM 209 211 10:00-10:30 PM 1002 1002 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 240 241 10:30-11:00 PM 1034 1034 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 521 525 11:00-11:30 PM 1112 1112 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM 839 840 11:30-12:00 PM 1140 1140 MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00026507

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET L-TIER DATE: 08/10/2019
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document contains handwritten entries in the table and appears to be a record of observations of inmates. The document is stamped with the MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT logo.
